result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

0 jail credit if revoked from Probation

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations, including but not limited to Domestic Abuse Assessment.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon R Jackson

records.addlTxt:
10:12 AM Defendant Brandon R Jackson in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brandon R Jackson.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. The parties have an agreement.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 3: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders: 18 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions
Conditions of Probation:
No acts or threats of violance against anyone.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations, including but not limited to Domestic Abuse Assessment.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Court costs and applicable surcharges.

0 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.
Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

9:51 AM case called. Defendant Brandon R Jackson in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brandon R Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/3/22.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 9/12/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 9/21/2022.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through 3rd party.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.

Order to amend bond and conditions of bond to remove the condition of no contact with C.M. and C.M.'s residence and add the condition of no acts or threats of violence. All other conditions of bond shall remain in effect until further order of the Court.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon R Jackson in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brandon R Jackson. Attorney Hillestad was just appointed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/22/22 at 1:15pm
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
